caption.p: Modeling evolutionary rescue potential under future climate change in ( A) M. escalerai and ( B) M. crypticus, depicted as the predicted density of movement (yellow is high and blue is low) from populations or individuals adapted to hot–dry conditions (white circles) to those adapted to cold–wet conditions (gray circles) based on the effect of slope and tree cover ( A) or slope and forest cover ( B) on movement. The relationship between landscape resistance and genetic differentiation in M. escalerai ( C) and M. crypticus ( D). Fst is Wright’s fixation index measure of population differentiation resulting from genetic structure.
